begin_unit
begin_comment
comment|/*  * jconfig.txt  *  * Copyright (C) 1991-1994, Thomas G. Lane.  * This file is part of the Independent JPEG Group's software.  * For conditions of distribution and use, see the accompanying README file.  *  * This file documents the configuration options that are required to  * customize the JPEG software for a particular system.  *  * The actual configuration options for a particular installation are stored  * in jconfig.h.  On many machines, jconfig.h can be generated automatically  * or copied from one of the "canned" jconfig files that we supply.  But if  * you need to generate a jconfig.h file by hand, this file tells you how.  *  * DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE --- IT WON'T ACCOMPLISH ANYTHING.  * EDIT A COPY NAMED JCONFIG.H.  */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/*  * These symbols indicate the properties of your machine or compiler.  * #define the symbol if yes, #undef it if no.  */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* Does your compiler support function prototypes?  * (If not, you also need to use ansi2knr, see install.txt)  */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_PROTOTYPES
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_PROTOTYPES
end_define
begin_comment
comment|/* Does your compiler support the declaration "unsigned char" ?  * How about "unsigned short" ?  */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_UNSIGNED_CHAR
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_UNSIGNED_CHAR
end_define
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_UNSIGNED_SHORT
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_UNSIGNED_SHORT
end_define
begin_comment
comment|/* Define "void" as "char" if your compiler doesn't know about type void.  * NOTE: be sure to define void such that "void *" represents the most general  * pointer type, e.g., that returned by malloc().  */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* #define void char */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* Define "const" as empty if your compiler doesn't know the "const" keyword.  */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* #define const */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if an ordinary "char" type is unsigned.  * If you're not sure, leaving it undefined will work at some cost in speed.  * If you defined HAVE_UNSIGNED_CHAR then the speed difference is minimal.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|CHAR_IS_UNSIGNED
undef|#
directive|undef
name|CHAR_IS_UNSIGNED
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your system has an ANSI-conforming<stddef.h> file.  */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_STDDEF_H
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_STDDEF_H
end_define
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your system has an ANSI-conforming<stdlib.h> file.  */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_STDLIB_H
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_STDLIB_H
end_define
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your system does not have an ANSI/SysV<string.h>,  * but does have a BSD-style<strings.h>.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|NEED_BSD_STRINGS
undef|#
directive|undef
name|NEED_BSD_STRINGS
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your system does not provide typedef size_t in any of the  * ANSI-standard places (stddef.h, stdlib.h, or stdio.h), but places it in  *<sys/types.h> instead.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|NEED_SYS_TYPES_H
undef|#
directive|undef
name|NEED_SYS_TYPES_H
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* For 80x86 machines, you need to define NEED_FAR_POINTERS,  * unless you are using a large-data memory model or 80386 flat-memory mode.  * On less brain-damaged CPUs this symbol must not be defined.  * (Defining this symbol causes large data structures to be referenced through  * "far" pointers and to be allocated with a special version of malloc.)  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|NEED_FAR_POINTERS
undef|#
directive|undef
name|NEED_FAR_POINTERS
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your linker needs global names to be unique in less  * than the first 15 characters.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|NEED_SHORT_EXTERNAL_NAMES
undef|#
directive|undef
name|NEED_SHORT_EXTERNAL_NAMES
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Although a real ANSI C compiler can deal perfectly well with pointers to  * unspecified structures (see "incomplete types" in the spec), a few pre-ANSI  * and pseudo-ANSI compilers get confused.  To keep one of these bozos happy,  * define INCOMPLETE_TYPES_BROKEN.  This is not recommended unless you  * actually get "missing structure definition" warnings or errors while  * compiling the JPEG code.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|INCOMPLETE_TYPES_BROKEN
undef|#
directive|undef
name|INCOMPLETE_TYPES_BROKEN
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define "boolean" as unsigned char, not int, on Windows systems.  */
end_comment
begin_ifdef
ifdef|#
directive|ifdef
name|_WIN32
end_ifdef
begin_ifndef
ifndef|#
directive|ifndef
name|__RPCNDR_H__
end_ifndef
begin_comment
comment|/* don't conflict if rpcndr.h already read */
end_comment
begin_typedef
DECL|typedef|boolean
typedef|typedef
name|unsigned
name|char
name|boolean
typedef|;
end_typedef
begin_endif
endif|#
directive|endif
end_endif
begin_define
DECL|macro|HAVE_BOOLEAN
define|#
directive|define
name|HAVE_BOOLEAN
end_define
begin_comment
DECL|macro|HAVE_BOOLEAN
comment|/* prevent jmorecfg.h from redefining it */
end_comment
begin_endif
endif|#
directive|endif
end_endif
begin_comment
comment|/*  * The following options affect code selection within the JPEG library,  * but they don't need to be visible to applications using the library.  * To minimize application namespace pollution, the symbols won't be  * defined unless JPEG_INTERNALS has been defined.  */
end_comment
begin_ifdef
ifdef|#
directive|ifdef
name|JPEG_INTERNALS
end_ifdef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your compiler implements ">>" on signed values as a logical  * (unsigned) shift; leave it undefined if ">>" is a signed (arithmetic) shift,  * which is the normal and rational definition.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|RIGHT_SHIFT_IS_UNSIGNED
undef|#
directive|undef
name|RIGHT_SHIFT_IS_UNSIGNED
end_undef
begin_endif
endif|#
directive|endif
end_endif
begin_comment
comment|/* JPEG_INTERNALS */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/*  * The remaining options do not affect the JPEG library proper,  * but only the sample applications cjpeg/djpeg (see cjpeg.c, djpeg.c).  * Other applications can ignore these.  */
end_comment
begin_ifdef
ifdef|#
directive|ifdef
name|JPEG_CJPEG_DJPEG
end_ifdef
begin_comment
comment|/* These defines indicate which image (non-JPEG) file formats are allowed. */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|BMP_SUPPORTED
define|#
directive|define
name|BMP_SUPPORTED
end_define
begin_comment
DECL|macro|BMP_SUPPORTED
comment|/* BMP image file format */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|GIF_SUPPORTED
define|#
directive|define
name|GIF_SUPPORTED
end_define
begin_comment
DECL|macro|GIF_SUPPORTED
comment|/* GIF image file format */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|PPM_SUPPORTED
define|#
directive|define
name|PPM_SUPPORTED
end_define
begin_comment
DECL|macro|PPM_SUPPORTED
comment|/* PBMPLUS PPM/PGM image file format */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|RLE_SUPPORTED
undef|#
directive|undef
name|RLE_SUPPORTED
end_undef
begin_comment
DECL|macro|RLE_SUPPORTED
comment|/* Utah RLE image file format */
end_comment
begin_define
DECL|macro|TARGA_SUPPORTED
define|#
directive|define
name|TARGA_SUPPORTED
end_define
begin_comment
DECL|macro|TARGA_SUPPORTED
comment|/* Targa image file format */
end_comment
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if you want to name both input and output files on the command  * line, rather than using stdout and optionally stdin.  You MUST do this if  * your system can't cope with binary I/O to stdin/stdout.  See comments at  * head of cjpeg.c or djpeg.c.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|TWO_FILE_COMMANDLINE
undef|#
directive|undef
name|TWO_FILE_COMMANDLINE
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if your system needs explicit cleanup of temporary files.  * This is crucial under MS-DOS, where the temporary "files" may be areas  * of extended memory; on most other systems it's not as important.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|NEED_SIGNAL_CATCHER
undef|#
directive|undef
name|NEED_SIGNAL_CATCHER
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* By default, we open image files with fopen(...,"rb") or fopen(...,"wb").  * This is necessary on systems that distinguish text files from binary files,  * and is harmless on most systems that don't.  If you have one of the rare  * systems that complains about the "b" spec, define this symbol.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|DONT_USE_B_MODE
undef|#
directive|undef
name|DONT_USE_B_MODE
end_undef
begin_comment
comment|/* Define this if you want percent-done progress reports from cjpeg/djpeg.  */
end_comment
begin_undef
DECL|macro|PROGRESS_REPORT
undef|#
directive|undef
name|PROGRESS_REPORT
end_undef
begin_endif
endif|#
directive|endif
end_endif
begin_comment
comment|/* JPEG_CJPEG_DJPEG */
end_comment
end_unit
